backend/main.mo: Actor providing user-scoped scenario templates and current-scenario persistence with permission checks and CRUD operations.
backend/migration.mo: Initializes empty maps and counters for the new actor’s template and scenario state during migration.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence listing implemented features, associated files, components, and test IDs for tracking.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of numerous frontend TypeScript files describing their purpose in the app.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS config defining theme variables, light/dark mode palettes, and base styling.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point loading the root React app with main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app wiring authentication, scenario loading/autosave, and rendering the scenario builder and results.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthControl: Login/logout UI for Internet Identity with principal display and query cache clearing.
frontend/src/components/results/Breakdow: Table component showing detailed per-weapon attacker/defender combat breakdown values.
frontend/src/components/results/ChanceTo: UI card that lets users select a defender and displays the calculated probability of killing at least one model.
frontend/src/components/results/DamageCh: Shows a bar chart of expected damage per defender based on deterministic results.
frontend/src/components/results/ExportBu: Dropdown button allowing export of combat results as JSON or CSV.
frontend/src/components/results/Histogra: Renders a histogram of damage frequencies from simulation results.
frontend/src/components/results/ResultsD: Main results view handling deterministic and simulation modes, rendering charts, summaries, and export options.
frontend/src/components/results/Simulati: Provides input and button to run Monte Carlo simulations with configurable iteration count.
frontend/src/components/results/SummaryC: Displays total expected damage and kills plus a breakdown of kills per defender.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Attacke: Editor for attacker units allowing modification of name, model count, and weapons.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Defende: Editor for defender units enabling changes to stats like model count, toughness, save, wounds, and invuln.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Presets: Empty file placeholder for scenario presets panel.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Priorit: Card for selecting target priority mode with descriptive helper text.
frontend/src/components/scenario/SavedTe: UI panel for saving, loading, and deleting scenario templates with authentication handling.
frontend/src/components/scenario/Scenari: Main editor for constructing combat scenarios, managing attackers, defenders, weapons, and template loading.
frontend/src/components/scenario/WeaponE: Form component for editing a weapon’s stats and special rules, with remove support.
frontend/src/engine/chanceToKill.ts: Computes approximate chance to kill models using expected damage and a normal-distribution approximation.
frontend/src/engine/deterministicExpecte: Calculates deterministic expected hits, wounds, and damage for a weapon against a defender, including special rules.
frontend/src/engine/dice.ts: Parses dice notation, computes average values, and performs random dice rolls.
frontend/src/engine/priority.ts: Sorts defenders according to selected targeting priority rules.
frontend/src/engine/probability.ts: Helpers for D6 reroll probabilities, wound/save logic, and related probability calculations.
frontend/src/engine/random.ts: Simple random D6 and D3 dice roll utilities.
frontend/src/engine/resolveScenario.ts: Computes deterministic expected combat outcomes across all attacker–defender pairs, generating damage totals, kill estimates, and a detailed breakdown.
frontend/src/engine/simulation.ts: Runs Monte Carlo simulations of combat scenarios, modeling rolls step‑by‑step to produce statistical outputs like mean, median, percentiles, and histograms.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to Internet Identity, refreshing dependent queries when identity or actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useCurrentScenarioPer: Provides React Query hooks to load and save the user's current scenario via the backend, handling authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useDebouncedValue.ts: Returns a debounced version of a value that updates after a specified delay.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Manages Internet Identity auth state, providing login, logout, stored identity restoration, and context for authentication.
frontend/src/hooks/useSavedTemplates.ts: Defines hooks to fetch, save, and delete user scenario templates through the backend using React Query.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles plus custom CSS variables for light and dark themes with a Warhammer‑inspired palette.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, setting up React Query and the Internet Identity provider before rendering App.
frontend/src/models/combat.ts: Defines TypeScript models for units, weapons, defenders, scenarios, and result structures for deterministic and simulated combat.
frontend/src/presets/builtInPresets.ts: Empty placeholder file for built‑in scenario presets.
frontend/src/state/useScenarioState.ts: Manages local scenario state with functions to add, remove, and update attackers, defenders, weapons, and priority settings.
frontend/src/state/validation.ts: Provides numeric and dice-notation validation helpers for scenario inputs.
frontend/src/utils/exportResults.ts: Exports combat scenario results to downloadable JSON or CSV files.
frontend/src/utils/scenarioPersistence.t: Serializes and deserializes CombatScenario objects for backend-compatible storage.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading, storing, and clearing URL and session parameters.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending theme colors, fonts, animations, and enabling plugins.
project_state.json: Metadata describing project version, architecture, features, and planned shifts in functionality.
